result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court adjourned sentencing hearing; Atty Woodard moved to withdraw the Defendant's plea; the DA's Office received referrals for new charges and refused to proceed with the agreement that was put on the record at the time the Defendant entered his plea; Atty Sattler stated her position on the record as to the breach of the agreement; Court ordered counsel to simultaneously submit briefs by the close of business on 01-25-2016 with any response briefs due by the close of business on 02-12-2015

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s).  Court accepted def's plea, found and adjudged defn guilty. Bail continued.  State agrees to cap at a non prison disposition but both parties free to argue terms and length of probation.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.
